page.description: If checked, enables Persistent login for the UX component.

discussion.p: A common pattern in mobile applications is to not require the user to login to the application after they have successfully logged in for the first time. The login should be persistent until is is explicitly revoked by the action of an Administrator, or until the end of the persistent login period is reached.
The *[ui:Persistent login]* property enables persistent login for a UX component with Integrated login functionality enabled. This property is primarily used with the [Login UX].
Enabling this property exposes [Callback functions that are always allowed], [Login duration (seconds)], and [Login Panel].

links.link: Callback functions that are always allowed
